etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish آپرمق (aparmak), from Old Anatolian Turkish [script needed] (aparmaq), likely from *alıp barmak, in which case it would be equivalent to alıp + varmak (“to go”). Compare Azerbaijani aparmaq, Uzbek obormoq, Uyghur ئاپارماق (aparmaq), Kyrgyz алпаруу (alparuu), Shor апар (“to take away”), Kazakh апару (aparu), Southern Altai апар- (apar-, “to take away”), etc.
